Detailed Description

Each TaylorTerm encapsulates a polynomial in the Taylor expansion of the energy of a given displacement. Each TaylorTerm contains a polynomial, prefactor, and derivative component. See prefactor_ and indices_.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gigide::TaylorTerm::TaylorTerm ( std::vector< int > &  indices  ) 

Constructor. Each displacement energy can be expanded as a Taylor series in a set of Taylor series terms

where is the coffiecient of the ith term, is the ith derivative, and is ith polynomial. See indices_ for an example. This class represent a single term in the expansion.

Parameters:
indices The indices defining the term. See Derivative::indices()

) [static]

Recursion method for generating terms. See generateTerms.

Parameters:
terms The vector to contain the created terms
current_depth The number of spots that have been filled. For example, if doing 3rd derivatives, you might have already placed all index possibilities in the first spot, and will have two index spots left to place.
maxdepth The total number of index spots to fill.
ncoords The number of coordinates

Member Data Documentation

double gigide::TaylorTerm::coef_ [private]

The coefficient of the given polynomial in an expansion.

std::vector<int> gigide::TaylorTerm::indices_ [private]

The indices defining this term in the Taylor series. For example, the term

would be represented by <1,2,4,4>. This is the index representation. See Derivative::indices().

double gigide::TaylorTerm::prefactor_ [private]

The Taylor prefactor associated with the taylor Term. See indices_.
